More politics coverage

Sole Mattapan slaying survivor testifies

Marcus Hurd, who is paralyzed from the neck down after being shot in the head during the Mattapan slayings, recounted the incident in court today. (Globe, 11:43 a.m.)
  • Live Blog: Court updates from the Globe's Maria Cramer

SJC: Cities do not have to pay state's share of Quinn bill payments to officers

The unanimous ruling from the Supreme Judicial Court could save municipalities millions of dollars and cut the size of some officers' paychecks. (Globe, 11:30 a.m.)

Elderly woman dies in Haverhill fire

One woman died and two others were injured in the early-morning, two-alarm fire in a Washington Street apartment building. (Globe, 11:44 a.m.)

Father faces charges in laser incident

Joseph Cordes of Winthrop is accused of aiming a laser pointer into the eyes of the opposing goalie at his daughter's high school hockey game. (Boston Globe)
